column4: I am curious.... anyone know offhand how it may be possible (or is it even possible) to make it so that Winblows and Ubuntu share a common hard drive for the installation of programs, file storing, etc?
if you format a partition as FAT32, windows and linux will both be able to read it.
I'd highly recommend FAT32 over ntfs, as ntfs support for linux is not as fully tested as FAT32
Well, NTFS seems to be the way to go, and Vista is definitely compatible with that one.
